-- | API related to Postgres' pg dump
module Hasura.Server.API.PGDump
data PGDumpReqBody
PGDumpReqBody :: !SourceName -> ![String] -> !Bool -> PGDumpReqBody
[prbSource] :: PGDumpReqBody -> !SourceName
[prbOpts] :: PGDumpReqBody -> ![String]
[prbCleanOutput] :: PGDumpReqBody -> !Bool
execPGDump :: (MonadError QErr m, MonadIO m) => PGDumpReqBody -> ConnInfo -> m ByteString
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.Server.API.PGDump.PGDumpReqBody
instance GHC.Show.Show Hasura.Server.API.PGDump.PGDumpReqBody
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Hasura.Server.API.PGDump.PGDumpReqBody

module Hasura.GraphQL.Execute.Subscription.Options
data SubscriptionsOptions
SubscriptionsOptions :: !BatchSize -> !RefetchInterval -> SubscriptionsOptions
[_lqoBatchSize] :: SubscriptionsOptions -> !BatchSize
[_lqoRefetchInterval] :: SubscriptionsOptions -> !RefetchInterval
type LiveQueriesOptions = SubscriptionsOptions
type StreamQueriesOptions = SubscriptionsOptions
mkSubscriptionsOptions :: Maybe BatchSize -> Maybe RefetchInterval -> SubscriptionsOptions
newtype BatchSize
BatchSize :: NonNegativeInt -> BatchSize
[unBatchSize] :: BatchSize -> NonNegativeInt
mkBatchSize :: Int -> Maybe BatchSize
newtype RefetchInterval
RefetchInterval :: NonNegativeDiffTime -> RefetchInterval
[unRefetchInterval] :: RefetchInterval -> NonNegativeDiffTime
mkRefetchInterval :: DiffTime -> Maybe RefetchInterval
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Hasura.GraphQL.Execute.Subscription.Options.BatchSize
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Hasura.GraphQL.Execute.Subscription.Options.BatchSize
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.GraphQL.Execute.Subscription.Options.BatchSize
instance GHC.Show.Show Hasura.GraphQL.Execute.Subscription.Options.BatchSize
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Hasura.GraphQL.Execute.Subscription.Options.RefetchInterval
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Hasura.GraphQL.Execute.Subscription.Options.RefetchInterval
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.GraphQL.Execute.Subscription.Options.RefetchInterval
instance GHC.Show.Show Hasura.GraphQL.Execute.Subscription.Options.RefetchInterval
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.GraphQL.Execute.Subscription.Options.SubscriptionsOptions
instance GHC.Show.Show Hasura.GraphQL.Execute.Subscription.Options.SubscriptionsOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Hasura.GraphQL.Execute.Subscription.Options.SubscriptionsOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Hasura.GraphQL.Execute.Subscription.Options.SubscriptionsOptions


-- | Types for representing a GraphQL schema.
module Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema
class HasName a
getName :: HasName a => a -> Name

-- | Type name customization
newtype MkTypename
MkTypename :: (Name -> Name) -> MkTypename
[runMkTypename] :: MkTypename -> Name -> Name

-- | Inject a new <tt>MkTypename</tt> customization function into the
--   environment. This can be used by schema-building code (with
--   <tt>MonadBuildSchema</tt> constraint) to ensure the correct type name
--   customizations are applied.
withTypenameCustomization :: forall m r a. (MonadReader r m, Has MkTypename r) => MkTypename -> m a -> m a

-- | Apply the type name customization function from the current
--   environment.
mkTypename :: (MonadReader r m, Has MkTypename r) => Name -> m Name

-- | GraphQL types are divided into two classes: input types and output
--   types. The GraphQL spec does not use the word “kind” to describe these
--   classes, but it’s an apt term.
--   
--   Some GraphQL types can be used at either kind, so we also include the
--   <a>Both</a> kind, the superkind of both <a>Input</a> and
--   <a>Output</a>. The <a>&lt;:</a> class provides kind subsumption
--   constraints.
--   
--   For more details, see
--   <a>http://spec.graphql.org/June2018/#sec-Input-and-Output-Types</a>.
data Kind

-- | see Note [The 'Both kind]
Both :: Kind
Input :: Kind
Output :: Kind

-- | Evidence for <a>&lt;:</a>.
data k1 :<: k2
[KRefl] :: k :<: k
[KBoth] :: k :<: 'Both

-- | <a>Kind</a> subsumption. The GraphQL kind hierarchy is extremely
--   simple:
--   
--   <pre>
--       Both
--       /  \
--   Input  Output
--   </pre>
--   
--   Various functions in this module use <a>&lt;:</a> to allow <a>Both</a>
--   to be used in places where <a>Input</a> or <a>Output</a> would
--   otherwise be expected.
class k1 <: k2
subKind :: (<:) k1 k2 => k1 :<: k2
data Nullability
Nullable :: Nullability
NonNullable :: Nullability
isNullable :: Nullability -> Bool
data Type k
TNamed :: Nullability -> Definition (TypeInfo k) -> Type k
TList :: Nullability -> Type k -> Type k

-- | Like <a>==</a>, but can compare <a>Type</a>s of different kinds.
eqType :: Type k1 -> Type k2 -> Bool
typeNullability :: Type k -> Nullability
nullableType :: Type k -> Type k
nonNullableType :: Type k -> Type k
toGraphQLType :: Type k -> GType

-- | Invariant: the list is sorted by <a>dName</a>
data InputObjectInfo
InputObjectInfo__ :: ~[Definition InputFieldInfo] -> InputObjectInfo
pattern InputObjectInfo :: [Definition InputFieldInfo] -> InputObjectInfo

-- | Invariant: the lists are sorted by <a>dName</a>, maintained via
--   pattern synonyms
data ObjectInfo
ObjectInfo__ :: ~[Definition FieldInfo] -> ~[Definition InterfaceInfo] -> ObjectInfo

-- | The fields that this object has. This consists of the fields of the
--   interfaces that it implements, as well as any additional fields.
[_oiFields] :: ObjectInfo -> ~[Definition FieldInfo]

-- | The interfaces that this object implements (inheriting all their
--   fields). See Note [The interfaces story] for more details.
[_oiImplements] :: ObjectInfo -> ~[Definition InterfaceInfo]
pattern ObjectInfo :: [Definition FieldInfo] -> [Definition InterfaceInfo] -> ObjectInfo

-- | Type information for a GraphQL interface; see Note [The interfaces
--   story] for more details.
--   
--   Note: in the current working draft of the GraphQL specification (&gt;
--   June 2018), interfaces may implement other interfaces, but we
--   currently don't support this.
--   
--   Invariant: the lists are sorted by <a>dName</a>, maintained via
--   pattern synonyms
data InterfaceInfo
InterfaceInfo__ :: ~[Definition FieldInfo] -> ~[Definition ObjectInfo] -> InterfaceInfo

-- | Fields declared by this interface. Every object implementing this
--   interface must include those fields.
[_iiFields] :: InterfaceInfo -> ~[Definition FieldInfo]

-- | Objects that implement this interface. See Note [The interfaces story]
--   for why we include that information here.
[_iiPossibleTypes] :: InterfaceInfo -> ~[Definition ObjectInfo]
pattern InterfaceInfo :: [Definition FieldInfo] -> [Definition ObjectInfo] -> InterfaceInfo

-- | Invariant: the list is sorted by <a>dName</a>
data UnionInfo
UnionInfo__ :: ~[Definition ObjectInfo] -> UnionInfo

-- | The member object types of this union.
[_uiPossibleTypes] :: UnionInfo -> ~[Definition ObjectInfo]
pattern UnionInfo :: [Definition ObjectInfo] -> UnionInfo
data TypeInfo k
[TIScalar] :: TypeInfo 'Both

-- | Invariant: the NonEmpty is sorted by <a>dName</a>
[TIEnum__] :: NonEmpty (Definition EnumValueInfo) -> TypeInfo 'Both
[TIInputObject] :: InputObjectInfo -> TypeInfo 'Input
[TIObject] :: ObjectInfo -> TypeInfo 'Output
[TIInterface] :: InterfaceInfo -> TypeInfo 'Output
[TIUnion] :: UnionInfo -> TypeInfo 'Output
pattern TIEnum :: forall (k :: Kind). () => k ~ 'Both => NonEmpty (Definition EnumValueInfo) -> TypeInfo k

-- | Like <a>==</a>, but can compare <a>TypeInfo</a>s of different kinds.
eqTypeInfo :: TypeInfo k1 -> TypeInfo k2 -> Bool
getTypeInfo :: Type k -> Definition (TypeInfo k)
getObjectInfo :: Type k -> Maybe (Definition ObjectInfo)
getInterfaceInfo :: Type k -> Maybe (Definition InterfaceInfo)
data SomeDefinitionTypeInfo
SomeDefinitionTypeInfo :: Definition (TypeInfo k) -> SomeDefinitionTypeInfo
data Definition a
Definition :: Name -> Maybe Description -> ~a -> Definition a
[dName] :: Definition a -> Name
[dDescription] :: Definition a -> Maybe Description

-- | Lazy to allow mutually-recursive type definitions.
[dInfo] :: Definition a -> ~a

-- | equivalent to, but faster than...
--   
--   <pre>
--   map dName x == map dName y
--   </pre>
eqByName :: [Definition a] -> [Definition a] -> Bool

-- | Enum values have no extra information except for the information
--   common to all definitions, so this is just a placeholder for use as
--   <tt><a>Definition</a> <a>EnumValueInfo</a></tt>.
data EnumValueInfo
EnumValueInfo :: EnumValueInfo
data InputFieldInfo

-- | An input field with a type and possibly a default value. If a default
--   value is provided, it should be a valid value for the type.
--   
--   Note that a default value of <a>VNull</a> is subtly different from
--   having no default value at all. If no default value is provided (i.e.
--   <a>Nothing</a>), the GraphQL specification allows distinguishing
--   provided <tt>null</tt> values from values left completely absent; see
--   Note [The value of omitted fields] in
--   Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Internal.Parser.
InputFieldInfo :: Type k -> Maybe (Value Void) -> InputFieldInfo
data FieldInfo
FieldInfo :: [Definition InputFieldInfo] -> Type k -> FieldInfo
[fArguments] :: FieldInfo -> [Definition InputFieldInfo]
[fType] :: FieldInfo -> Type k

-- | See Note [Parsing variable values].
data InputValue v
GraphQLValue :: Value v -> InputValue v
JSONValue :: Value -> InputValue v
data Variable
Variable :: VariableInfo -> GType -> InputValue Void -> Variable
[vInfo] :: Variable -> VariableInfo
[vType] :: Variable -> GType

-- | Note: if the variable was null or was not provided and the field has a
--   non-null default value, this field contains the default value, not
--   <a>VNull</a>.
[vValue] :: Variable -> InputValue Void
data VariableInfo
VIRequired :: Name -> VariableInfo

-- | Unlike fields (see <a>InputFieldInfo</a>), nullable variables with no
--   default value are indistinguishable from variables with a default
--   value of null, so we don’t distinguish those cases here.
VIOptional :: Name -> Value Void -> VariableInfo

-- | This type represents the directives information to be served over
--   GraphQL introspection
data DirectiveInfo
DirectiveInfo :: !Name -> !Maybe Description -> ![Definition InputFieldInfo] -> ![DirectiveLocation] -> DirectiveInfo
[diName] :: DirectiveInfo -> !Name
[diDescription] :: DirectiveInfo -> !Maybe Description
[diArguments] :: DirectiveInfo -> ![Definition InputFieldInfo]
[diLocations] :: DirectiveInfo -> ![DirectiveLocation]

-- | This type contains all the information needed to efficiently serve
--   GraphQL introspection queries. It corresponds to the GraphQL
--   <tt>__Schema</tt> type defined in <a>4.5 Schema Introspection
--   http://spec.graphql.org/June2018/#sec-Introspection</a>. See also Note
--   [Basics of introspection schema generation].
data Schema
Schema :: Maybe Description -> HashMap Name SomeDefinitionTypeInfo -> Type 'Output -> Maybe (Type 'Output) -> Maybe (Type 'Output) -> [DirectiveInfo] -> Schema
[sDescription] :: Schema -> Maybe Description
[sTypes] :: Schema -> HashMap Name SomeDefinitionTypeInfo
[sQueryType] :: Schema -> Type 'Output
[sMutationType] :: Schema -> Maybe (Type 'Output)
[sSubscriptionType] :: Schema -> Maybe (Type 'Output)
[sDirectives] :: Schema -> [DirectiveInfo]
data TypeDefinitionsWrapper
[TypeDefinitionsWrapper] :: HasTypeDefinitions a => a -> TypeDefinitionsWrapper

-- | Recursively collects all type definitions accessible from the given
--   value, attempting to detect any conflicting defintions that may have
--   made it this far (See <a>ConflictingDefinitions</a> for details).
collectTypeDefinitions :: HasTypeDefinitions a => a -> Either ConflictingDefinitions (HashMap Name SomeDefinitionTypeInfo)

-- | A path through <a>Definition</a>, accumulated in
--   <a>accumulateTypeDefinitions</a> only to power
--   <a>ConflictingDefinitions</a> in the error case.
newtype TypeOriginStack
TypeOriginStack :: [Name] -> TypeOriginStack
typeOriginRecurse :: Name -> TypeOriginStack -> TypeOriginStack
typeRootRecurse :: Name -> TypeOriginStack -> TypeOriginStack

-- | NOTE: it's not clear exactly where we'd get conflicting definitions at
--   the point <a>collectTypeDefinitions</a> is called, but conflicting
--   names from different data sources is apparently one place (TODO some
--   tests that excercise this).
--   
--   ALSO NOTE: it's difficult to see in isolation how or if this check is
--   correct since <a>Definition</a> is cyclic and has no accomodations for
--   observable sharing (formerly it had Uniques; see commit history and
--   discussion in #3685). The check relies on dodgy Eq instances for the
--   types that make up the Definition graph (see e.g. <tt>instance Eq
--   ObjectInfo</tt>).
--   
--   See Note [Collecting types from the GraphQL schema]
data ConflictingDefinitions

-- | Type collection has found at least two types with the same name.
ConflictingDefinitions :: (SomeDefinitionTypeInfo, TypeOriginStack) -> (SomeDefinitionTypeInfo, NonEmpty TypeOriginStack) -> ConflictingDefinitions

-- | Although the majority of graphql-engine is written in terms of
--   abstract mtl-style effect monads, we figured out that this particular
--   codepath is quite hot, and that mtl has a measurable negative effect
--   for accumulating types from the schema, both in profiling and in
--   benchmarking. Using an explicit transformers-style effect stack seems
--   to overall memory usage by about 3-7%.
newtype TypeAccumulation a
TypeAccumulation :: ReaderT TypeOriginStack (StateT (HashMap Name (SomeDefinitionTypeInfo, NonEmpty TypeOriginStack)) (ExceptT ConflictingDefinitions Identity)) a -> TypeAccumulation a
[runTypeAccumulation] :: TypeAccumulation a -> ReaderT TypeOriginStack (StateT (HashMap Name (SomeDefinitionTypeInfo, NonEmpty TypeOriginStack)) (ExceptT ConflictingDefinitions Identity)) a
class HasTypeDefinitions a

-- | Recursively accumulates all type definitions accessible from the given
--   value. This is done statefully to avoid infinite loops arising from
--   recursive type definitions; see Note [Tying the knot] in
--   Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Class.
accumulateTypeDefinitions :: HasTypeDefinitions a => a -> TypeAccumulation ()
instance GHC.Base.Monoid Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.MkTypename
instance GHC.Base.Semigroup Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.MkTypename
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Nullability
instance GHC.Generics.Generic (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Definition a)
instance Data.Traversable.Traversable Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Definition
instance Data.Foldable.Foldable Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Definition
instance GHC.Base.Functor Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Definition
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.EnumValueInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.EnumValueInfo
instance Language.Haskell.TH.Syntax.Lift v => Language.Haskell.TH.Syntax.Lift (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.InputValue v)
instance GHC.Classes.Ord v => GHC.Classes.Ord (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.InputValue v)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.InputValue v)
instance GHC.Base.Functor Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.InputValue
instance GHC.Classes.Eq v => GHC.Classes.Eq (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.InputValue v)
instance GHC.Show.Show v => GHC.Show.Show (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.InputValue v)
instance Language.Haskell.TH.Syntax.Lift Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.VariableInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.VariableInfo
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.VariableInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.VariableInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.VariableInfo
instance Language.Haskell.TH.Syntax.Lift Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Variable
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Variable
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Variable
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Variable
instance GHC.Show.Show Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Variable
instance Control.Monad.Error.Class.MonadError Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.ConflictingDefinitions Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.TypeAccumulation
instance Control.Monad.State.Class.MonadState (Data.HashMap.Internal.HashMap Language.GraphQL.Draft.Syntax.Name (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.SomeDefinitionTypeInfo, GHC.Base.NonEmpty Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.TypeOriginStack)) Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.TypeAccumulation
instance Control.Monad.Reader.Class.MonadReader Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.TypeOriginStack Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.TypeAccumulation
instance GHC.Base.Monad Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.TypeAccumulation
instance GHC.Base.Applicative Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.TypeAccumulation
instance GHC.Base.Functor Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.TypeAccumulation
instance Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.HasTypeDefinitions Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.TypeDefinitionsWrapper
instance Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.HasTypeDefinitions (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Definition (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.TypeInfo k))
instance Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.HasTypeDefinitions a => Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.HasTypeDefinitions [a]
instance Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.HasTypeDefinitions a => Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.HasTypeDefinitions (GHC.Maybe.Maybe a)
instance Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.HasTypeDefinitions (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Type k)
instance Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.HasTypeDefinitions (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.TypeInfo k)
instance Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.HasTypeDefinitions (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Definition Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.InputObjectInfo)
instance Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.HasTypeDefinitions (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Definition Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.InputFieldInfo)
instance Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.HasTypeDefinitions Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.InputFieldInfo
instance Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.HasTypeDefinitions (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Definition Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.FieldInfo)
instance Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.HasTypeDefinitions Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.FieldInfo
instance Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.HasTypeDefinitions (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Definition Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.ObjectInfo)
instance Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.HasTypeDefinitions (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Definition Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.InterfaceInfo)
instance Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.HasTypeDefinitions (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Definition Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.UnionInfo)
instance Data.Text.Extended.ToTxt Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.TypeOriginStack
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Variable

instance Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.HasName Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.SomeDefinitionTypeInfo

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.InterfaceInfo

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.InputFieldInfo

instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.EnumValueInfo

instance Data.Functor.Classes.Eq1 Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Definition
instance Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.HasName (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Definition a)
instance (k1 GHC.Types.~ k2) => k1 Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.<: k2
instance k Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.<: 'Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Both
instance Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.HasName Language.GraphQL.Draft.Syntax.Name


-- | Provides utilities to convert a runtime schema back to a static
--   intrsospection schema.
module Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.Convert

-- | Convert back from our "live" schema representation into a flat static
--   set of definitions.
convertToSchemaIntrospection :: Schema -> SchemaIntrospection
convertType :: SomeDefinitionTypeInfo -> TypeDefinition [Name] InputValueDefinition
convertEnumValue :: Definition EnumValueInfo -> EnumValueDefinition
convertInputField :: Definition InputFieldInfo -> InputValueDefinition
convertField :: Definition FieldInfo -> FieldDefinition InputValueDefinition
getDefinitionName :: Definition a -> Name
noDirectives :: [Directive Void]


-- | Defines the <a>Parser</a> type and its primitive combinators.
module Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Internal.Types

-- | A <a>Parser</a> that corresponds to a type in the GraphQL schema. A
--   <a>Parser</a> is really two things at once:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li>As its name implies, a <a>Parser</a> can be used to parse GraphQL
--   queries (via <a>runParser</a>).</li>
--   <li>Less obviously, a <a>Parser</a> represents a slice of the GraphQL
--   schema, since every <a>Parser</a> corresponds to a particular GraphQL
--   type, and information about that type can be recovered (via
--   <a>parserType</a>).</li>
--   </ol>
--   
--   A natural way to view this is that <a>Parser</a>s support a sort of
--   dynamic reflection: in addition to running a <a>Parser</a> on an input
--   query, you can ask it to tell you about what type of input it expects.
--   Importantly, you can do this even if you don’t have a query to parse;
--   this is necessary to implement GraphQL introspection, which provides
--   precisely this sort of reflection on types.
--   
--   Another way of viewing a <a>Parser</a> is a little more quantum: just
--   as light “sometimes behaves like a particle and sometimes behaves like
--   a wave,” a <a>Parser</a> “sometimes behaves like a query parser and
--   sometimes behaves like a type.” In this way, you can think of a
--   function that produces a <a>Parser</a> as simultaneously both a
--   function that constructs a GraphQL schema and a function that parses a
--   GraphQL query. <a>Parser</a> constructors therefore interleave two
--   concerns: information about a type definition (like the type’s name
--   and description) and information about how to parse a query on that
--   type.
--   
--   Notably, these two concerns happen at totally different phases in the
--   program: GraphQL schema construction happens when
--   <tt>graphql-engine</tt> first starts up, before it receives any
--   GraphQL queries at all. But query parsing obviously can’t happen until
--   there is actually a query to parse. For that reason, it’s useful to
--   take care to distinguish which effects are happening at which phase
--   during <a>Parser</a> construction, since otherwise you may get mixed
--   up!
--   
--   For some more information about how to interpret the meaning of a
--   <a>Parser</a>, see Note [The meaning of Parser 'Output].
data Parser k m a
Parser :: ~Type k -> (ParserInput k -> m a) -> Parser k m a

-- | Lazy for knot-tying reasons; see Note [Tying the knot] in
--   Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Class.
[pType] :: Parser k m a -> ~Type k
[pParser] :: Parser k m a -> ParserInput k -> m a
type family ParserInput k
parserType :: Parser k m a -> Type k
runParser :: Parser k m a -> ParserInput k -> m a
instance GHC.Base.Functor m => GHC.Base.Functor (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Internal.Types.Parser k m)
instance Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Schema.HasName (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Internal.Types.Parser k m a)


-- | Classes for monads used during schema construction and query parsing.
module Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Class

-- | A class that provides functionality used when building the GraphQL
--   schema, i.e. constructing the <a>Parser</a> graph.
class (Monad m, MonadParse n) => MonadSchema n m | m -> n

-- | Memoizes a parser constructor function for the extent of a single
--   schema construction process. This is mostly useful for recursive
--   parsers; see Note [Tying the knot] for more details.
--   
--   The generality of the type here allows us to use this with multiple
--   concrete parser types:
--   
--   <pre>
--   <a>memoizeOn</a> :: <a>MonadSchema</a> n m =&gt; <a>Name</a> -&gt; a -&gt; m (Parser n b) -&gt; m (Parser n b)
--   <a>memoizeOn</a> :: <a>MonadSchema</a> n m =&gt; <a>Name</a> -&gt; a -&gt; m (FieldParser n b) -&gt; m (FieldParser n b)
--   </pre>
memoizeOn :: forall p a b. (MonadSchema n m, HasCallStack, Ord a, Typeable p, Typeable a, Typeable b) => Name -> a -> m (p n b) -> m (p n b)

-- | A wrapper around <a>memoizeOn</a> that memoizes a function by using
--   its argument as the key.
memoize :: (HasCallStack, MonadSchema n m, Ord a, Typeable a, Typeable b, Typeable k) => Name -> (a -> m (Parser k n b)) -> a -> m (Parser k n b)


-- | Monad transformers for GraphQL schema construction and query parsing.
module Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Monad
newtype SchemaT n m a
SchemaT :: StateT (DMap ParserId (ParserById n)) m a -> SchemaT n m a
[unSchemaT] :: SchemaT n m a -> StateT (DMap ParserId (ParserById n)) m a
runSchemaT :: forall m n a. Monad m => SchemaT n m a -> m a

-- | A key used to distinguish calls to <a>memoize</a>d functions. The
--   <a>Name</a> distinguishes calls to completely different parsers, and
--   the <tt>a</tt> value records the arguments.
data ParserId (t :: ((Type -> Type) -> Type -> Type, Type))
[ParserId] :: (Ord a, Typeable p, Typeable a, Typeable b) => Name -> a -> ParserId '(p, b)

-- | A newtype wrapper around a <tt>Parser</tt> that rearranges the type
--   parameters so that it can be indexed by a <a>ParserId</a> in a
--   <a>DMap</a>.
--   
--   This is really just a single newtype, but it’s implemented as a data
--   family because GHC doesn’t allow ordinary datatype declarations to
--   pattern-match on type parameters, and we want to match on the tuple.
data family ParserById (m :: Type -> Type) (a :: ((Type -> Type) -> Type -> Type, Type))
newtype ParseT m a
ParseT :: ReaderT JSONPath (ValidateT (NESeq ParseError) m) a -> ParseT m a
[unParseT] :: ParseT m a -> ReaderT JSONPath (ValidateT (NESeq ParseError) m) a
runParseT :: Functor m => ParseT m a -> m (Either (NESeq ParseError) a)
data ParseError
ParseError :: JSONPath -> Text -> Code -> ParseError
[pePath] :: ParseError -> JSONPath
[peMessage] :: ParseError -> Text
[peCode] :: ParseError -> Code
reportParseErrors :: MonadError QErr m => NESeq ParseError -> m a
instance Control.Monad.Reader.Class.MonadReader r m => Control.Monad.Reader.Class.MonadReader r (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Monad.SchemaT n m)
instance Control.Monad.Error.Class.MonadError e m => Control.Monad.Error.Class.MonadError e (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Monad.SchemaT n m)
instance GHC.Base.Monad m => GHC.Base.Monad (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Monad.SchemaT n m)
instance GHC.Base.Monad m => GHC.Base.Applicative (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Monad.SchemaT n m)
instance GHC.Base.Functor m => GHC.Base.Functor (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Monad.SchemaT n m)
instance GHC.Base.Monad m => GHC.Base.Monad (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Monad.ParseT m)
instance GHC.Base.Monad m => GHC.Base.Applicative (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Monad.ParseT m)
instance GHC.Base.Functor m => GHC.Base.Functor (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Monad.ParseT m)
instance Control.Monad.Trans.Class.MonadTrans Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Monad.ParseT
instance GHC.Base.Monad m => Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Class.Parse.MonadParse (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Monad.ParseT m)
instance (Control.Monad.IO.Class.MonadIO m, Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Class.Parse.MonadParse n) => Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Class.MonadSchema n (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Monad.SchemaT n m)
instance (Control.Monad.IO.Class.MonadIO m, Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Class.Parse.MonadParse n) => Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Class.MonadSchema n (Control.Monad.Trans.Reader.ReaderT a (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Monad.SchemaT n m))
instance Data.GADT.Internal.GEq Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Monad.ParserId
instance Data.GADT.Internal.GCompare Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Monad.ParserId


-- | Here are all functions related to type-checking within the schema.
--   This includes functions that deal with variables, and functions that
--   craft error messages.
module Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Internal.TypeChecking

-- | Peeling a variable.
--   
--   Whenever we need to inspect a value, for instance when parsing the
--   value of an input argument, there are two main cases: either we have a
--   GraphQL literal (be it explicitly given, or a default argument), or we
--   have a variable:
--   
--   where(limit: 42) where(limit: $limit)
--   
--   In the case of a variable, we need to "open" it and inspect its
--   content. This forces us to do several things:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li>Type-checking We know what the variable was declared as, we know
--   what type we expect at our current location in the schema: we can
--   check that they match.</li>
--   <li>Update re-usability In the past, we used to cache the generated
--   execution plan for a given query. To do so properly, we had to
--   identify queries that couldn't be cached; and any root field that uses
--   the content of a variable (outside of a column's value) couldn't be
--   cached: the same graphql expression would lead to a different
--   execution plan if the value of the variable were to change. We no
--   longer cache execution plans; but we might do it again in the future,
--   which is why we haven't removed some of the code that deals with
--   re-usability.</li>
--   </ol>
peelVariable :: MonadParse m => GType -> InputValue Variable -> m (InputValue Variable)
peelVariableWith :: MonadParse m => Bool -> GType -> InputValue Variable -> m (InputValue Variable)

-- | Type-checking.
--   
--   Checks whether the type of a variable is compatible with the type at
--   the location at which it is used. This is an implementation of the
--   function described in §5.8.5 of the spec:
--   <a>http://spec.graphql.org/June2018/#sec-All-Variable-Usages-are-Allowed</a>
--   
--   No input type coercion is allowed between variables: coercion rules
--   only allow when translating a value from a literal. It is therefore
--   not allowed to use an Int variable at a Float location, despite the
--   fact that it is legal to use an Int literal at a Float location.
--   
--   Furthermore, it's also worth noting that there's one tricky case where
--   we might allow a nullable variable at a non-nullable location: when
--   either side has a non-null default value. That's because GraphQL
--   conflates nullability and optionality. See also Note [When are fields
--   optional?].
typeCheck :: MonadParse m => Bool -> GType -> Variable -> m ()
isVariableUsageAllowed :: Bool -> GType -> Variable -> Bool
typeMismatch :: (HasName n, MonadParse m) => n -> Text -> InputValue Variable -> m a
describeValue :: InputValue Variable -> Text
describeValueWith :: (var -> Text) -> InputValue var -> Text


-- | Defines the <a>Parser</a> type and its primitive combinators.
module Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Internal.Input
inputParserInput :: forall k. 'Input <: k => ParserInput k :~: InputValue Variable
pInputParser :: forall k m a. 'Input <: k => Parser k m a -> InputValue Variable -> m a

-- | Parses some collection of input fields. Build an
--   <a>InputFieldsParser</a> using <a>field</a>, <a>fieldWithDefault</a>,
--   or <a>fieldOptional</a>, combine several together with the
--   <a>Applicative</a> instance, and finish it off using <a>object</a> to
--   turn it into a <a>Parser</a>.
data InputFieldsParser m a
InputFieldsParser :: [Definition InputFieldInfo] -> (HashMap Name (InputValue Variable) -> m a) -> InputFieldsParser m a
[ifDefinitions] :: InputFieldsParser m a -> [Definition InputFieldInfo]
[ifParser] :: InputFieldsParser m a -> HashMap Name (InputValue Variable) -> m a

-- | Creates a parser for an input field. For nullable value parsers, if an
--   input field is omitted, the provided parser <i>will be called</i> with
--   a value of <a>null</a>.
field :: (MonadParse m, 'Input <: k) => Name -> Maybe Description -> Parser k m a -> InputFieldsParser m a

-- | Creates a parser for a nullable field with no default value. If the
--   field is omitted, the provided parser <i>will not be called</i>. This
--   allows a field to distinguish an omitted field from a field supplied
--   with <tt>null</tt> (which is permitted by the GraphQL specification);
--   see Note [The value of omitted fields] for more details.
--   
--   If you want a field with a default value of <tt>null</tt>, use
--   <a>field</a> with a nullable value parser, instead.
fieldOptional :: (MonadParse m, 'Input <: k) => Name -> Maybe Description -> Parser k m a -> InputFieldsParser m (Maybe a)

-- | Creates a parser for an input field with the given default value. The
--   resulting field will always be optional, even if the underlying parser
--   rejects <a>null</a> values. The underlying parser is always called.
fieldWithDefault :: (MonadParse m, 'Input <: k) => Name -> Maybe Description -> Value Void -> Parser k m a -> InputFieldsParser m a
enum :: MonadParse m => Name -> Maybe Description -> NonEmpty (Definition EnumValueInfo, a) -> Parser 'Both m a
object :: MonadParse m => Name -> Maybe Description -> InputFieldsParser m a -> Parser 'Input m a
list :: forall k m a. (MonadParse m, 'Input <: k) => Parser k m a -> Parser k m [a]
instance GHC.Base.Functor m => GHC.Base.Functor (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Internal.Input.InputFieldsParser m)
instance GHC.Base.Applicative m => GHC.Base.Applicative (Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Internal.Input.InputFieldsParser m)


-- | This module defines all functions that convert between different
--   representations of values in the schema; most commonly: GraphQL
--   literals, JSON values, and <a>InputValue</a>, a type that provides an
--   abstraction above both of those.
module Hasura.GraphQL.Parser.Internal.Convert
valueToJSON :: MonadParse m => GType -> InputValue Variable -> m Value
jsonToGraphQL :: MonadError Text m => Value -> m (Value Void)


-- | Implements <i>variable resolution</i> for GraphQL queries, which
--   annotates the use site of each GraphQL variable with its value.
module Hasura.GraphQL.Execute.Resolve
resolveVariables :: forall m fragments. (MonadError QErr m, Traversable fragments) => [VariableDefinition] -> VariableValues -> [Directive Name] -> SelectionSet fragments Name -> m ([Directive Variable], SelectionSet fragments Variable)


-- | Postgres Types CitusExtraTableMetadata
--   
--   Additional metadata information for Citus tables.
--   
--   See
--   <a>https://www.citusdata.com/blog/2017/07/27/database-table-types-with-citus-and-postgres/</a>
--   for more details on the Citus table types.
module Hasura.Backends.Postgres.Types.CitusExtraTableMetadata
data ExtraTableMetadata
Local :: ExtraTableMetadata
Reference :: ExtraTableMetadata
Distributed :: Text -> ExtraTableMetadata
[distributionColumn] :: ExtraTableMetadata -> Text
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Hasura.Backends.Postgres.Types.CitusExtraTableMetadata.ExtraTableMetadata
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Hasura.Backends.Postgres.Types.CitusExtraTableMetadata.ExtraTableMetadata
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Hasura.Backends.Postgres.Types.CitusExtraTableMetadata.ExtraTableMetadata
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.Backends.Postgres.Types.CitusExtraTableMetadata.ExtraTableMetadata
instance GHC.Show.Show Hasura.Backends.Postgres.Types.CitusExtraTableMetadata.ExtraTableMetadata
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Hasura.Backends.Postgres.Types.CitusExtraTableMetadata.ExtraTableMetadata
instance Hasura.Incremental.Internal.Dependency.Cacheable Hasura.Backends.Postgres.Types.CitusExtraTableMetadata.ExtraTableMetadata
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Hasura.Backends.Postgres.Types.CitusExtraTableMetadata.ExtraTableMetadata


-- | Postgres Execute Types
--   
--   Execution context and source configuration for Postgres databases.
--   Provides support for things such as read-only transactions and read
--   replicas.
module Hasura.Backends.Postgres.Execute.Types
type RunTx = forall m a. (MonadIO m, MonadBaseControl IO m) => TxET QErr m a -> ExceptT QErr m a
data PGExecCtx
PGExecCtx :: RunTx -> RunTx -> RunTx -> IO () -> PGExecCtx

-- | Run a Q.ReadOnly transaction
[_pecRunReadOnly] :: PGExecCtx -> RunTx

-- | Run a read only statement without an explicit transaction block
[_pecRunReadNoTx] :: PGExecCtx -> RunTx

-- | Run a Q.ReadWrite transaction
[_pecRunReadWrite] :: PGExecCtx -> RunTx

-- | Destroys connection pools
[_pecDestroyConn] :: PGExecCtx -> IO ()

-- | Creates a Postgres execution context for a single Postgres master pool
mkPGExecCtx :: TxIsolation -> PGPool -> PGExecCtx
defaultTxErrorHandler :: PGTxErr -> QErr

-- | Constructs a transaction error handler tailored for the needs of RQL's
--   DML.
dmlTxErrorHandler :: PGTxErr -> QErr

-- | Constructs a transaction error handler given a predicate that
--   determines which errors are expected and should be reported to the
--   user. All other errors are considered internal errors.
mkTxErrorHandler :: (PGErrorType -> Bool) -> PGTxErr -> QErr
data PGSourceConfig
PGSourceConfig :: !PGExecCtx -> !ConnInfo -> !Maybe (NonEmpty ConnInfo) -> !IO () -> PGSourceConfig
[_pscExecCtx] :: PGSourceConfig -> !PGExecCtx
[_pscConnInfo] :: PGSourceConfig -> !ConnInfo
[_pscReadReplicaConnInfos] :: PGSourceConfig -> !Maybe (NonEmpty ConnInfo)
[_pscPostDropHook] :: PGSourceConfig -> !IO ()
runPgSourceReadTx :: (MonadIO m, MonadBaseControl IO m) => PGSourceConfig -> TxET QErr m a -> m (Either QErr a)
runPgSourceWriteTx :: (MonadIO m, MonadBaseControl IO m) => PGSourceConfig -> TxET QErr m a -> m (Either QErr a)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Hasura.Backends.Postgres.Execute.Types.PGSourceConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.Backends.Postgres.Execute.Types.PGSourceConfig
instance Hasura.Incremental.Internal.Dependency.Cacheable Hasura.Backends.Postgres.Execute.Types.PGSourceConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Hasura.Backends.Postgres.Execute.Types.PGSourceConfig

[_ppsIdleTimeout] :: PostgresPoolSettings -> !Maybe Int
[_ppsRetries] :: PostgresPoolSettings -> !Maybe Int

[_ppsConnectionLifetime] :: PostgresPoolSettings -> !Maybe NominalDiffTime

-- | MSSQL Connection
--   
--   This module handles the connection against an MS SQL Server. It
--   defines the connection string, connection pool, default settings, and
--   conversion functions between MSSQL and graphql-engine.
module Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection
class MonadError QErr m => MonadMSSQLTx m
liftMSSQLTx :: MonadMSSQLTx m => TxE QErr a -> m a

-- | ODBC connection string for MSSQL server
newtype MSSQLConnectionString
MSSQLConnectionString :: Text -> MSSQLConnectionString
[unMSSQLConnectionString] :: MSSQLConnectionString -> Text
data InputConnectionString
RawString :: !ConnectionString -> InputConnectionString
FromEnvironment :: !Text -> InputConnectionString
data MSSQLPoolSettings
MSSQLPoolSettings :: !Int -> !Int -> MSSQLPoolSettings
[_mpsMaxConnections] :: MSSQLPoolSettings -> !Int
[_mpsIdleTimeout] :: MSSQLPoolSettings -> !Int
defaultMSSQLPoolSettings :: MSSQLPoolSettings
data MSSQLConnectionInfo
MSSQLConnectionInfo :: !InputConnectionString -> !MSSQLPoolSettings -> MSSQLConnectionInfo
[_mciConnectionString] :: MSSQLConnectionInfo -> !InputConnectionString
[_mciPoolSettings] :: MSSQLConnectionInfo -> !MSSQLPoolSettings
data MSSQLConnConfiguration
MSSQLConnConfiguration :: !MSSQLConnectionInfo -> !Maybe (NonEmpty MSSQLConnectionInfo) -> MSSQLConnConfiguration
[_mccConnectionInfo] :: MSSQLConnConfiguration -> !MSSQLConnectionInfo
[_mccReadReplicas] :: MSSQLConnConfiguration -> !Maybe (NonEmpty MSSQLConnectionInfo)
createMSSQLPool :: MonadIO m => QErrM m => MSSQLConnectionInfo -> Environment -> m (ConnectionString, MSSQLPool)
resolveInputConnectionString :: QErrM m => Environment -> InputConnectionString -> m ConnectionString
getEnv :: QErrM m => Environment -> Text -> m Text
type MSSQLRunTx = forall m a. (MonadIO m, MonadBaseControl IO m) => TxET QErr m a -> ExceptT QErr m a

-- | Execution Context required to execute MSSQL transactions
data MSSQLExecCtx
MSSQLExecCtx :: MSSQLRunTx -> MSSQLRunTx -> IO () -> MSSQLExecCtx

-- | A function that runs read-only queries
[mssqlRunReadOnly] :: MSSQLExecCtx -> MSSQLRunTx

-- | A function that runs read-write queries; run in a transaction
[mssqlRunReadWrite] :: MSSQLExecCtx -> MSSQLRunTx

-- | Destroys connection pools
[mssqlDestroyConn] :: MSSQLExecCtx -> IO ()

-- | Creates a MSSQL execution context for a single primary pool
mkMSSQLExecCtx :: MSSQLPool -> MSSQLExecCtx
data MSSQLSourceConfig
MSSQLSourceConfig :: !ConnectionString -> !MSSQLExecCtx -> MSSQLSourceConfig
[_mscConnectionString] :: MSSQLSourceConfig -> !ConnectionString
[_mscExecCtx] :: MSSQLSourceConfig -> !MSSQLExecCtx
odbcValueToJValue :: Value -> Value
runMSSQLSourceReadTx :: (MonadIO m, MonadBaseControl IO m) => MSSQLSourceConfig -> TxET QErr m a -> m (Either QErr a)
runMSSQLSourceWriteTx :: (MonadIO m, MonadBaseControl IO m) => MSSQLSourceConfig -> TxET QErr m a -> m (Either QErr a)

instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MSSQLConnConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MSSQLConnConfiguration
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MSSQLConnConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MSSQLConnConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MSSQLConnConfiguration
instance Hasura.Incremental.Internal.Dependency.Cacheable Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MSSQLConnConfiguration

instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MSSQLConnectionString
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MSSQLConnectionString
instance GHC.Show.Show Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MSSQLConnectionString

instance GHC.Generics.Generic Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MSSQLPoolSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MSSQLPoolSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MSSQLPoolSettings
instance Hasura.Incremental.Internal.Dependency.Cacheable Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MSSQLPoolSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MSSQLPoolSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MSSQLPoolSettings
instance Hasura.Incremental.Internal.Dependency.Cacheable Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.InputConnectionString
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.InputConnectionString
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.InputConnectionString
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.InputConnectionString
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.InputConnectionString
instance Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MonadMSSQLTx m => Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MonadMSSQLTx (Control.Monad.Trans.Reader.ReaderT s m)
instance Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MonadMSSQLTx m => Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MonadMSSQLTx (Control.Monad.Trans.State.Strict.StateT s m)
instance (GHC.Base.Monoid w, Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MonadMSSQLTx m) => Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MonadMSSQLTx (Control.Monad.Trans.Writer.Strict.WriterT w m)
instance Control.Monad.IO.Class.MonadIO m => Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.Connection.MonadMSSQLTx (Database.MSSQL.Transaction.TxET Hasura.Base.Error.QErr m)
instance Hasura.Incremental.Internal.Dependency.Cacheable Database.MSSQL.Pool.ConnectionString
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Database.MSSQL.Pool.ConnectionString
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Database.MSSQL.Pool.ConnectionString

module Hasura.Backends.MSSQL.DDL.Source.Version
latestSourceCatalogVersion :: Int
latestSourceCatalogVersionText :: Text
setSourceCatalogVersion :: MonadMSSQLTx m => Int -> m ()
getSourceCatalogVersion :: MonadMSSQLTx m => m Int

module Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name

-- | A tagged, opaque wrapper around <a>Text</a> that provides a number of
--   derived derived instances (primarily as required by the
--   <tt>Backend</tt> typeclass).
--   
--   This wrapper is indexed by <a>NameType</a> so that different "names"
--   can be represented as semantically distinct types without the
--   boilerplate of actually defining these wrappers separately.
newtype Name ty
Name :: Text -> Name ty
[unName] :: Name ty -> Text

-- | The "type" of "name" that the <a>Name</a> type is meant to provide a
--   textual representation for.
--   
--   In other words: an enumeration of all the types for which <a>Name</a>
--   acts as a shared abstraction.
data NameType
Column :: NameType
Function :: NameType
Table :: NameType
instance Data.Text.Extended.ToTxt (Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Name ty)
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey (Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Name ty)
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON (Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Name ty)
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData (Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Name ty)
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable (Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Name ty)
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey (Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Name ty)
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON (Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Name ty)
instance Hasura.Incremental.Internal.Dependency.Cacheable (Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Name ty)
instance GHC.Show.Show (Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Name ty)
instance GHC.Classes.Ord (Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Name ty)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic (Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Name ty)
instance GHC.Classes.Eq (Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Name ty)
instance Data.Typeable.Internal.Typeable ty => Data.Data.Data (Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Name ty)
instance Witch.From.From Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.API.V0.Table.TableName (Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Name 'Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Table)
instance Witch.From.From (Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Name 'Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Table) Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.API.V0.Table.TableName
instance Witch.From.From Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.API.V0.Column.ColumnName (Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Name 'Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Column)
instance Witch.From.From (Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Name 'Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Name.Column) Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.API.V0.Column.ColumnName

module Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Table

-- | An alias for <a>Table</a> <a>Name</a>s.
--   
--   This alias is defined in its own module primarily for the convenience
--   of importing it qualified.
--   
--   For example: @ import Data.Coerce (coerce) import
--   Hasura.Experimental.IR.Table qualified as Table (Name)
--   
--   example :: Table.Name example = coerce <tt>Text </tt>Table.Name
--   "table_name" @
type Name = Name 'Table

module Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Function

-- | An alias for <a>Function</a> <a>Name</a>s.
--   
--   This alias is defined in its own module primarily for the convenience
--   of importing it qualified.
--   
--   For example: @ import Data.Coerce (coerce) import
--   Hasura.Experimental.IR.Function qualified as Function (Name)
--   
--   example :: Function.Name example = coerce <tt>Text </tt>Function.Name
--   "function_name" @
type Name = Name 'Function

module Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Column

-- | An alias for <a>Column</a> <a>Name</a>s.
--   
--   This alias is defined in its own module primarily for the convenience
--   of importing it qualified.
--   
--   For example: @ import Data.Coerce (coerce) import
--   Hasura.Experimental.IR.Column qualified as Column (Name)
--   
--   example :: Column.Name example = coerce <tt>Text </tt>Column.Name
--   "column_name" @
type Name = Name 'Column

module Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.Schema.Column

-- | A schematic representation which captures common attributes associated
--   with a piece of data that is stored in a given backend.
--   
--   These attributes ascribe meaningful semantics to the data that they
--   are associated with.
--   
--   cf. <a>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Column_(database)</a>
--   <a>https://www.postgresql.org/docs/13/ddl-basics.html</a>
--   
--   XXX: Instead of an <tt>isNullable</tt> flag, should we instead add a
--   <tt>Nullable</tt> data constructor to <a>Type</a>?
data Column
Column :: Name -> Type -> Bool -> Maybe Text -> Column
[name] :: Column -> Name
[type_] :: Column -> Type
[isNullable] :: Column -> Bool
[description] :: Column -> Maybe Text
instance GHC.Show.Show Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.Schema.Column.Column
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.Schema.Column.Column
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.Schema.Column.Column
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.Schema.Column.Column
instance Data.Data.Data Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.Schema.Column.Column

module Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.Schema.Table

-- | A schematic representation which captures a named collection of
--   columns
--   
--   TODO(cdparks): schematic in the sense of "relating to a schema" or
--   symbolic? This language is also used in the <tt>Column</tt>
--   documentation
--   
--   An element of a table is known as a row, record, tuple, or object, and
--   conforms to the shape specified by the list of <tt>Column</tt>s below.
--   
--   cf. <a>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Table_(database)</a>
--   <a>https://www.postgresql.org/docs/13/ddl-basics.html</a>
--   
--   NOTE(jkachmar): This type shouldn't _need_ ser/de instances, but
--   they're imposed by the <tt>Backend</tt> class.
data Table
Table :: Name -> [Column] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Table
[name] :: Table -> Name
[columns] :: Table -> [Column]
[primaryKey] :: Table -> Maybe Text
[description] :: Table -> Maybe Text
instance GHC.Show.Show Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.Schema.Table.Table
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.Schema.Table.Table
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.Schema.Table.Table
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.Schema.Table.Table
instance Data.Data.Data Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.Schema.Table.Table

module Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy

-- | Indicates a particular sort order that should be applied based on some
--   <a>Name</a> returned within a data source query.
--   
--   TODO: We should use a sum type like <tt>Query.Field</tt> here so that
--   we can handle <tt>order by</tt> constraints on object/array
--   relationships as well.
--   
--   cf. <a>https://www.postgresql.org/docs/13/queries-order.html</a>
--   
--   NOTE: The <a>ToJSON</a> instance is only intended for logging
--   purposes.
data OrderBy
OrderBy :: Name -> OrderType -> OrderBy
[column] :: OrderBy -> Name
[ordering] :: OrderBy -> OrderType

-- | <a>Name</a>s may be sorted in either ascending or descending order.
--   
--   cf. <a>https://www.postgresql.org/docs/13/queries-order.html</a>
--   
--   NOTE: The <a>ToJSON</a> instance is only intended for logging
--   purposes.
data OrderType
Ascending :: OrderType
Descending :: OrderType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderType
instance Hasura.Incremental.Internal.Dependency.Cacheable Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderType
instance GHC.Show.Show Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderType
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderType
instance Data.Data.Data Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderBy
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderBy
instance Hasura.Incremental.Internal.Dependency.Cacheable Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderBy
instance GHC.Show.Show Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderBy
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderBy
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderBy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderBy
instance Data.Data.Data Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderBy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderBy
instance Witch.From.From Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.API.V0.OrderBy.OrderBy Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderBy
instance Witch.From.From Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderBy Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.API.V0.OrderBy.OrderBy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderType
instance Witch.From.From Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.API.V0.OrderBy.OrderType Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderType
instance Witch.From.From Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.OrderBy.OrderType Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.API.V0.OrderBy.OrderType

module Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression

-- | A "concrete" expression type for datasource-agnostic queries (as
--   opposed to our existing polymorphic intermediate representation).
--   
--   This type should be seen as an intermediate phase of the processing
--   pipeline which provides a high-level interface that the GraphQL Engine
--   can use to inspect, manipulate, optimize, etc. before sending off to
--   an agent that will be responsible for performing query
--   generation/execution.
--   
--   This type should ascribe clear semantics to its sub-expressions; when
--   this is not possible, it should clearly defer to the semantics of some
--   reference datasource with clearer documentation.
--   
--   e.g. <a>https://www.postgresql.org/docs/13/sql-expressions.html</a>
data Expression

-- | A constant <a>Value</a>.
Literal :: Value -> Expression

-- | A literal array of <a>Value</a>s.
--   
--   NOTE: This constructor is necessary for purposes of parsing into the
--   RQL IR but should never be exposed by the GDW API.
Array :: [Value] -> Expression

-- | A construct for making multiple comparisons between groups of
--   <a>Value</a>s.
--   
--   The right-hand side is a collection of unique <a>Value</a>s; the
--   result is "true" if the result of the left-hand <a>Expression</a> is
--   equal to any of these <a>Value</a>s.
--   
--   cf.
--   <a>https://www.postgresql.org/docs/13/functions-comparisons.html#FUNCTIONS-COMPARISONS-IN-SCALAR</a>
--   
--   Consider switching this to a <tt>Set</tt> after the typeclass methods
--   which use this type have been implemented and we have an opportunity
--   to see how its used in practice.
In :: Expression -> [Value] -> Expression

-- | A logical <tt>AND</tt> fold.
--   
--   cf. <a>https://www.postgresql.org/docs/13/functions-logical.html</a>
And :: [Expression] -> Expression

-- | A logical <tt>OR</tt> fold.
--   
--   cf. <a>https://www.postgresql.org/docs/13/functions-logical.html</a>
Or :: [Expression] -> Expression

-- | A logical <tt>NOT</tt> function.
--   
--   cf. <a>https://www.postgresql.org/docs/13/functions-logical.html</a>
Not :: Expression -> Expression

-- | A comparison predicate which returns "true" if an expression evaluates
--   to <a>Null</a>.
IsNull :: Expression -> Expression

-- | The textual name associated with some "column" of data within a
--   datasource.
--   
--   XXX(jkachmar): It's unclear whether "column" is the right descriptor
--   for this construct; what we want here seems closer to an "identifier".
--   
--   cf.
--   <a>https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/sql-syntax-lexical.html#SQL-SYNTAX-IDENTIFIERS</a>
Column :: Name -> Expression

-- | Apply a comparison <a>Operator</a> to two expressions; the result of
--   this application will return "true" or "false" depending on the
--   <a>Operator</a> that's being applied.
--   
--   XXX(jkachmar): Consider renaming <a>Operator</a> to
--   <tt>ComparisonOperator</tt> and this sub-expression to
--   <tt>ApplyComparisonOperator</tt> for clarity.
ApplyOperator :: Operator -> Expression -> Expression -> Expression

-- | Operators which are typically applied to two <a>Expression</a>s (via
--   the <a>ApplyOperator</a> sub-<a>Expression</a>) to perform a boolean
--   comparison.
--   
--   cf.
--   <a>https://www.postgresql.org/docs/13/functions-comparison.html</a>
--   
--   XXX(jkachmar): Comparison operations are tricky business!
--   
--   We should define the semantics of these comparisons in a way that is
--   clear and carefully considered.
data Operator
LessThan :: Operator
LessThanOrEqual :: Operator
GreaterThan :: Operator
GreaterThanOrEqual :: Operator
Equal :: Operator
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Operator
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Operator
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Operator
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Operator
instance Hasura.Incremental.Internal.Dependency.Cacheable Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Operator
instance GHC.Show.Show Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Operator
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Operator
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Operator
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Operator
instance Data.Data.Data Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Operator
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Expression
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Expression
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Expression
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Expression
instance Hasura.Incremental.Internal.Dependency.Cacheable Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Expression
instance GHC.Show.Show Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Expression
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Expression
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Expression
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Expression
instance Data.Data.Data Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Expression
instance Witch.From.From Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.API.V0.Expression.Operator Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Operator
instance Witch.From.From Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Expression.Operator Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.API.V0.Expression.Operator

module Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query

-- | An abstract request to retrieve structured data from some source.
--   
--   NOTE: The <a>ToJSON</a> instance is only intended for logging
--   purposes.
data Query
Query :: HashMap Text Field -> Name -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Expression -> [OrderBy] -> Cardinality -> Query
[fields] :: Query -> HashMap Text Field

-- | Reference to the table these fields are in.
[from] :: Query -> Name

-- | Optionally limit to N results.
[limit] :: Query -> Maybe Int

-- | Optionally offset from the Nth result.
[offset] :: Query -> Maybe Int

-- | Optionally constrain the results to satisfy some predicate.
[where_] :: Query -> Maybe Expression

-- | Optionally order the results by the value of one or more fields.
[orderBy] :: Query -> [OrderBy]

-- | The cardinality of response we expect from the Agent's response.
[cardinality] :: Query -> Cardinality

-- | This data structure keeps track of what cardinality of response we
--   should send back to the client for a given query, which may be
--   different from what we receive from the backend (which is always
--   possibly-many records).
data Cardinality
Many :: Cardinality
OneOrZero :: Cardinality

-- | The specific fields that are targeted by a <a>Query</a>.
--   
--   A field conceptually falls under one of the two following categories:
--   1. a "column" within the data store that the query is being issued
--   against 2. a "relationship", which indicates that the field is the
--   result of another query that must be executed on its own 3. a
--   "literal", which represents a piece of text, such as a
--   <tt>__typename</tt> field, which will appear in the final output and
--   is provided by HGE and not the Agent. NOTE: The <a>ToJSON</a> instance
--   is only intended for logging purposes.
data Field
Column :: ColumnContents -> Field
Relationship :: RelationshipContents -> Field
Literal :: Text -> Field

-- | TODO
--   
--   NOTE: The <a>ToJSON</a> instance is only intended for logging
--   purposes.
newtype ColumnContents
ColumnContents :: Name -> ColumnContents
[column] :: ColumnContents -> Name

-- | A relationship consists of the following components: - a sub-query,
--   from the perspective that a relationship field will occur within a
--   broader <a>Query</a> - a join condition relating the data returned by
--   the sub-query with that of the broader <a>Query</a>
--   
--   cf. <a>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Join_(SQL)</a>
--   <a>https://www.postgresql.org/docs/13/tutorial-join.html</a>
--   <a>https://www.postgresql.org/docs/13/queries-table-expressions.html#QUERIES-FROM</a>
--   
--   NOTE: The <a>ToJSON</a> instance is only intended for logging
--   purposes.
data RelationshipContents
RelationshipContents :: HashMap PrimaryKey ForeignKey -> Query -> RelationshipContents
[joinCondition] :: RelationshipContents -> HashMap PrimaryKey ForeignKey
[query] :: RelationshipContents -> Query

-- | TODO
--   
--   NOTE: The <a>ToJSON</a> instance is only intended for logging
--   purposes.
newtype PrimaryKey
PrimaryKey :: Name -> PrimaryKey

-- | TODO
--   
--   NOTE: The <a>ToJSON</a> instance is only intended for logging
--   purposes.
newtype ForeignKey
ForeignKey :: Name -> ForeignKey
instance GHC.Show.Show Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.Cardinality
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.Cardinality
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.Cardinality
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.Cardinality
instance Data.Data.Data Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.Cardinality
instance GHC.Show.Show Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.ColumnContents
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.ColumnContents
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.ColumnContents
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.ColumnContents
instance Data.Data.Data Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.ColumnContents
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.PrimaryKey
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.PrimaryKey
instance GHC.Show.Show Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.PrimaryKey
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.PrimaryKey
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.PrimaryKey
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.PrimaryKey
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.PrimaryKey
instance Data.Data.Data Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.PrimaryKey
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.ForeignKey
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.ForeignKey
instance GHC.Show.Show Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.ForeignKey
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.ForeignKey
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.ForeignKey
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.ForeignKey
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.ForeignKey
instance Data.Data.Data Hasura.Backends.DataConnector.IR.Query.ForeignKey
